Bash(Panels" submenu with 5 checkable items
- Each menu item toggles corresponding panel visibility
- Bidirectional synchronization:
  * Menu checks update when panel close button clicked
  * Panel shows/hides when menu item toggled
- "Device Settings Window" remains for popup view \(Ctrl+S\)

User Interface Features:
1. Collapse/Expand:
   - Click ▼ button to collapse panel \(hides content, shows ▶\)
   - Click ▶ button to expand panel \(shows content, shows ▼\)
   - Header remains visible when collapsed

2. Hide/Show:
   - Click ✕ button to completely hide panel
   - Use View > Panels menu to show hidden panels
   - Menu checkmark indicates panel visibility

3. Resize:
   - Drag horizontal divider between panels
   - Each panel can be sized independently
   - Panels remember size until next drag

4. Menu Control:
   - View > Panels > Battery Voltage \(toggle\)
   - View > Panels > Atrial Lead Impedance \(toggle\)
   - View > Panels > Ventricular Lead Impedance \(toggle\)
   - View > Panels > Arrhythmia Burden \(toggle\)
   - View > Panels > Device Settings \(toggle\)

Benefits:
- Customize view to focus on relevant data
- Hide panels with no data to reduce clutter
- Allocate more space to important trends
- Quick access to panel controls via menu
- Persistent panel state during session

Technical Implementation:
- QSplitter provides drag-to-resize functionality
- CollapsiblePanel wraps each widget
- PyQt signals synchronize UI state
- Panel visibility managed via show_panel/hide_panel methods
- Menu actions connected to toggle_panel method

User Workflow Examples:
- Focus on battery: Hide other panels, maximize battery panel
- Quick review: Collapse all panels, expand on demand
- Settings check: Hide trend panels, show only settings
- Full view: Show all panels, distribute evenly

Future Enhancements:
- Save panel layout preferences
- Preset layouts \(battery focus, leads focus, etc.\)
- Drag-and-drop panel reordering
- Panel grouping/tabbing
